response.original_title: Shadow Circus: The CIA in Tibet
response.overview: The Tibetan people are well known for being devoutly religious and peace-loving. Few, however, know that thousands of Tibetans took up arms against the invading forces of Communist China and for more than a decade waged a bitter and bloody guerrilla war of resistance. From the mid-1950s until 1969 the Tibetans were aided in their efforts by an unlikely ally: the CIA.
response.tagline: The Shadow Circus: The CIA in Tibet reveals for the first time this hitherto unknown chapter in Tibet's recent history â€“ a tale that is both heroic and tragic.
response.title: Shadow Circus: The CIA in Tibet
